channel.title: Morning Mail
channel.description: Stay updated on the latest news and events happening in the RPI community.

item.title: Don’t Forget Wellness Wednesdays!
item.description: Date: Wednesday, October 9, 2024 12:00 PM - 2:00 PM - A program dedicated to enhancing student health and well-being, Wellness Wednesdays offer a diverse range of activities and information sessions that focus on crucial life skills and aim to equip students with practical knowledge for maintaining physical, mental, and financial wellness throughout their college journey and beyond.
item.author: Students

item.title: SWE to Hold Professional General Body Meeting with Anne Ryan
item.description: Date: Thursday, October 10, 2024 5:30 PM - 6:30 PM - Join the Society of Women Engineers for a resume workshop hosted by the decorated conference speaker Anne Ryan! She will be joining us online, and you can attend either in the Shelnutt Gallery (room 3606) in the Rensselaer Union or via Webex!
item.author: Students

item.title: Intel Schedules October 9 Information Session for RPI Students
item.description: Students are invited to join Intel for an information session to be held at 6:00PM on Wednesday, October 9. The plan for this session is to provide a company overview and discuss internships and full-time positions; RPI alumni/Intel employee Kawser Ahmed will also discuss his engineering career, followed by a Q&A session.
item.author: Students

item.title: Co-Terminal Program Info Session to be Held October 9
item.description: Date: Wednesday, October 9, 2024 1:00 PM - 2:00 PM - The Office of Graduate Education invites students interested in learning about the application process and the great opportunities the Co-Terminal Program provides to attend this session! Please contact Steven Atkinson if you have any questions.
item.author: Students

item.title: Free Flu Shot Clinics Available for Students October 8, 10
item.description: The Student Health Center will be offering free flu shots for RPI students from 10:00AM until 4:00PM on Tuesday, October 8 in the DCC Great Hallway, and from from 10:00AM until 4:00PM on Thursday, October 10 in the Mueller Center lobby. No appointment is necessary, so just drop by to get your free flu shot!
item.author: Students

item.title: “Remembering the Stonewall Uprising – 55 Years Later” Exhibit on Display in Folsom Library
item.description: Date: Wednesday, September 25, 2024 - Tue , October 15, 2024 (all day) - On June 28, 1969, LGBTQ+ patrons at the Stonewall Inn in New York fought back against police harassment, helping to spawn the LGBTQIA+ rights movement. To honor this event, the LGBTQ+ Task Force is proud to present an exhibit on the history of the Stonewall Uprising on the main floor of Folsom Library, using archival sources from the Stonewall National Museum, Archives, and Library to show the Uprising’s important history.
item.author: Community

item.title: ECSE Seminar Scheduled for October 10
item.description: Date: Thursday, October 10, 2024 1:00 PM - 2:00 PM - Join ECSE for a seminar titled “Accelerating the Clean Energy Transition with Data Analytics and Computing” with Yousu Chen, Chief Engineer at Pacific Northwest National Laboratory.
item.author: Community

item.title: Rensselaer at Work to Hold Information Session October 11
item.description: Date: Friday, October 11, 2024 12:00 PM - 12:30 PM - Register to join Rensselaer at Work Dean Aric Krause, Ph. D., as he reviews Rensselaer’s online, project-based graduate degrees and certificates, and describes how RPI Instructor Mentors provide industry expertise, advice, and mentorship in a targeted and experiential learning environment.
item.author: Community

item.title: Physics, Applied Physics and Astronomy to Present Robert Resnick Lecture on October 16
item.description: Date: Wednesday, October 16, 2024 4:00 PM - 5:00 PM - Rensselaer’s department of Physics, Applied Physics and Astronomy is pleased to host this lecture featuring Dr. R. Michael Barnett, of the Lawrence Berkeley National Laboratory, who will present “Phantom of the Universe: The Hunt for Dark Matter.”
item.author: Community

item.title: Why It’s Time to Take Warnings about Using Public Wi-Fi, in Places Like Airports, Seriously
item.description: Over the years, travelers have repeatedly been warned to avoid public Wi-Fi in places like airports and coffee shops due to what is typically relatively lax security. But even though many people know they should stay away from free Wi-Fi, it proves as irresistible to travelers as it is to hackers, who are now updating an old cybercrime tactic to take advantage. Brian Callahan, Director of the Rensselaer Cybersecurity Collaboratory, offers some comments on the subject.
item.author: Community

item.title: EMPAC Schedules Viewing of Sharlene Bamboat’s “Both, Instrument & Sound”
item.description: Date: Friday, October 11, 2024 7:00 PM - Join curator Katherine C.M. Adams and artist Sharlene Bamboat for a viewing of the feature-length film, a look into a new installation-in-progress, and moderated discussion. Originally made as a 40 minute, one-channel film, the work offers an intimate and sensorially rich perspective on shifting practices of solidarity and alliance-building, and opens up to both political and intimate modes of relation.
item.author: Community

item.title: CBE to Continue Seminar Series October 9
item.description: Date: Wednesday, October 9, 2024 9:00 AM - 10:00 AM - Join the Chemical and Biological Engineering Deparment in welcoming Scott Shell to campus for his seminar titled “Water structure and computational design of water-mediated solute-surface interactions.” Refreshments will be served at 9:00AM in DCC 337.
item.author: Community

item.title: iEAR Presents Guest Speaker Terike Haapoja
item.description: The campus community is invited to come to the CBIS auditorium at 5:00PM on Wednesday, October 9 to hear Terike Haapoja discuss her recent art and research project, [Against] Animal Capitalism, which explores animal liberation and multi-species politics in the framework of anti-capitalist resistance.
item.author: Community

item.title: DotCIO Announces Upcoming Changes to Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) for Microsoft Services
item.description: Due to a change in how Microsoft and Duo communicate, effective October 16, 2024, there will be an update to the Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) interface for Microsoft services. As a result, users’ login experiences with Microsoft products such as Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Teams will change slightly.
item.author: Community

item.title: Flu, COVID Vaccines Being Offered to Faculty and Staff
item.description: In partnership with Rensselaer’s Division of Human Resources, Adirondack Health & Wellness is once again administering this year’s free flu and COVID-19 vaccine clinics for faculty and staff. Appointments are still available in October and November.
item.author: Faculty and Staff

item.title: Middle States Commission on Higher Education Preliminary Visit Scheduled for October 17
item.description:
Date: Thursday, October 17, 2024 - As part of the MSCHE self-study, Dr. Teik C. Lim, President of NJIT, and Dr. Deess, Executive Director of Institutional Effectiveness, will meet with Rensselaer’s Board of Trustees, senior leadership, faculty, staff, and students. The staff session begins at 1:15PM, and the faculty session at 2:00PM; participation is encouraged! Refer to the call for participation for more information.

For information about sharing your news or events, or to change your subscription settings, visit morningmail.rpi.edu.
item.author: Faculty and Staff
